text:
Q: Importing github repo as dependency in poetry in docker container A:

I was able to successfully install and use a Python library hosted in my private GitHub repository with Poetry during a Docker build after applying all of these steps:

  1. Use ssh mount with --mount=type=ssh on relevant RUN command

  2. Add host key of the git server (github.com in my case) to ~/.ssh/known_hosts

  3. Enable system-git-client configuration in poetry

  4. Build docker image with --ssh=default option.

Working Dockerfile:

FROM python:3.14-slim

ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive

RUN --mount=type=cache,target=/var/cache/apt \
  --mount=type=cache,target=/var/lib/apt/lists \
  rm -f /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/docker-clean && \
  apt-get update && \
  apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    build-essential \
    git \
    openssh-client \
  ;

RUN --mount=type=cache,target=/root/.cache/pip \
  pip3 install --upgrade pip && \
  pip3 install poetry==2.2.1

WORKDIR /app

RUN --mount=type=cache,target=/root/.cache/pip \
  --mount=type=bind,source=pyproject.toml,target=pyproject.toml \
  --mount=type=bind,source=poetry.lock,target=poetry.lock \
  --mount=type=ssh \
  mkdir -m 0700 ~/.ssh && ssh-keyscan github.com >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts && \
  poetry config system-git-client true && \
  poetry config virtualenvs.create false && \
  poetry install --only main --no-interaction

COPY . .

Build command:

docker build --ssh=default .

Q: Maven assembly plugin not creating tar files with directory entries? A:

Introduction

It seems to be a known «Apache Maven Assembly Plugin» issue:

  • The GitHub issue: [MASSEMBLY-759] tar outputs missing entries for target directory. · Issue #971 · apache/maven-assembly-plugin.

    • (Just for a reference. Deprecated.) This GitHub issue was migrated from the Jira issue: [MASSEMBLY-759] tar outputs missing entries for target directory. - ASF Jira.

Straightforward solution

Roughly speaking, the solution is:

  1. To communicate with the maintainers (for example, by posting comments on the GitHub issue).
  2. If applicable, to wait for a next «Apache Maven Assembly Plugin» release with the resolved issue.

Q: Pandas how to query columns that are lists or dicts? A:

Previously, I was dead set against any use of apply lambda, but this is actually quite simple. It's also more flexible than arbitrary explosion of the columns e.g. hobby_1, hobby_2, etc. because I can have lists of different lengths without sparsity. I can also add/remove address fields as needed e.g. zip+4 or delivery_location.

df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(data)

df[
    # Working with lists
    df['hobbies'].apply(lambda x: 'gaming' in x) &
    # Working with dicts
    df['address'].apply(lambda x: x['city'] == 'Anytown')
]

Result

Q: “Element type is invalid” error when component is inside src folder, but works when placed in node_modules A:

The reason you are getting the error;

“Element type is invalid … but got: object”

is that react throws this when it expects a component function, but instead receives a plain object. And your log shows exactly that:

{
  __esModule: true,
  default: ƒ Slider()
}

So Slider is an object, not the function itself.

And the reason why it works in node modules is that how your bundler handles ES module ↔ CommonJS interop.

react-slick is published as CommonJS, but your app is consuming it as ESM.

When imported from src/, your bundler (Vite / CRA / Webpack 5 / Next) does:

import Slider from "react-slick";

This returns the module namespace object, not the default export{ default: SliderFunction }

When the file is placed inside node_modules, the bundler applies CJS compatibility transforms, automatically resolving .default.

A workaround to this issue is to explicitly read the default export.


import SliderImport from "react-slick";
const Slider = SliderImport.default ?? SliderImport;

Then use <Slider />. This works in all bundlers and safe for both ESM and CJS

Q: how to solve "Uncaught TagError: adsbygoogle.push() error: All ins elements in the DOM with class=adsbygoogle already have ads in them." error A: 

if (adsbygoogle && !adsbygoogle.loaded)
      (adsbygoogle = (window as any).adsbygoogle || []).push({});

The solution by Sudhanshu Shekhar does not work for me, because loaded property is already true before push function called

Q: Some files appear with dropdown arrows like folders — how can I change this? A:

Solved: I found the issue.

When I ran yarn create vue to initialize the project, it also generated a .vscode folder with custom settings. After deleting that folder, the file explorer view returned to normal.
